TopicTitle: Add-on to Preserve Right Click Choices in Tracking View?

Articles.Content: When I'm switching between views using the M command - between the tracking view and the 3rd person view - I find it incredibly annoying that the display of the tracking view resets every time - which means I have to go around right-clicking everything I want to see again. It also hides the navball every time. I would love it if it just remembered the state it was in last time I was there... is there a mod that does this for me?
The navball is in the game's settings.  For the rest, when you say 'right click everything', do you mean showing the numbers at the various orbital points?

That's right. When I'm looking at the tracking view. With the maneuver nodes and orbit paths... I'm often in a situation where I want to see my AP/PE numbers and I want to see the distance to my target and so on... all of the numbers I can see my mousing over the item in question and if i right-click the item it will pin the information up so I don't have to mouse over. That's all great. But I often flip back and forth between this view and the 3rd person view and everytime I return to the tracking screen all of the right-click pinned information is gone. 

The place where this really gets frustrating is when I am very close to a ship I am going to rendezvous with... because for me when the ships are that close, clicking on them becomes a nightmare of fiddly-ness, ha...

Does this question make sense? I'm new to the game so maybe there's a solution that's obvious to this that I missed?
